official-title.#text: To amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to provide that the District of Columbia Treasurer or one of the Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer of the District of Columbia may perform the functions and duties of the Office in an acting capacity if there is a vacancy in the Office.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives April 15, 2013.

short-title.#text: District of Columbia Chief Financial Officer Vacancy Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorizing district of columbia treasurer or deputy chief financial officer of office of chief financial officer of the district of columbia to serve as acting chief financial officer in event of vacancy in office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (sec. 1–204.24(b), D.C. Official Code) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 424(b) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b

header.#text: Authorizing service in acting capacity in event of vacancy in office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3/sp:B

text.#text: the District of Columbia Treasurer shall serve as the Chief Financial Officer in an acting capacity, subject to the time limitation of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to serve as the Chief Financial Officer in an acting capacity, subject to the time limitation of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:a/p:3/sp:A..D
District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3/sp:B

text.#text: the Mayor may direct one of the Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , if there is a vacancy in the Office of Chief Financial Officer because the Chief Financial Officer has died, resigned, or is otherwise unable to perform the functions and duties of the Office—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3/sp:A/cl:ii

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , an individual may not serve as the Chief Financial Officer under such clause if the individual did not serve as the District of Columbia Treasurer or as one of such Deputy Chief Financial Officers of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (as the case may be) for at least 90 days during the 1-year period which ends on the date the vacancy occurs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3/sp:A/cl:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: after the expiration of the 210-day period which begins on the date the vacancy occurs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3/sp:A

text.#text: A vacancy in the Office of the Chief Financial Officer may not be filled by the service of any individual in an acting capacity under

header.#text: Authorizing treasurer or deputy CFO to perform duties in acting capacity in event of vacancy in office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (sec. 1–204.24(b)(2)(D), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:2/sp:D
District of Columbia Home Rule Act/s:424/ss:b/p:3

text.#text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to vacancies occurring on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1246 EH: District of Columbia Chief Financial Officer Vacancy Act
